revised_title: The Influence of Silicon, Sulfur, and Manganese on the Precipitation of Free Carbon in Iron-Carbon Alloys
tldr: This study investigates the effects of silicon, sulfur, and manganese on the precipitation of free carbon in iron-carbon alloys. The research reveals that these elements alter the composition and solubility of carbide in austenite, affecting the dissociation and precipitation of free carbon. The findings provide insights into the behavior of free carbon in various iron-based materials and their applications.
